model.tiles

Class CommercialTile

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.tiles.Tile
      • model.tiles.BuildableTile
        • model.tiles.CommercialTile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Destroyable, Evolvable

    public class CommercialTile
extends BuildableTile
    Enable to welcome new workers and consume energy units according to the number of workers. Sell (consume products) according to the number of people in the city and bound to the number of workers in the shop

      • update

        public void update(CityResources res)
        Update changes the state of the building if their are riot happening in the city and puts the building on riot mode so that it stops producing anything. If their are to much buildings on riot compared to the number set by the Riotevent, the buildings go back to usual. Then when the building is on the state "built" , given it's connection to the networks( road, power and water network) and the fact that enough energy are being produced or not it's workers population will rise or fall. It will also sell more or less products bound to the available energy.
        Specified by:
        update in class Tile

      • getWorkers

        private int getWorkers(CityResources res)
        Parameters:
        res -
        Returns:
        Approximation of the number of inhabitants in the current residence if the population is uniformly distributed. e.g. if the residence capacity is X = 50, the city capacity is Y = 100 (including X) and the population is Z = 20, then the residence has (X / Y) * Z = 10 inhabitants.
